name: Agile Methodologies
description: A set of values, principles, and practices that enable teams to deliver value faster and with higher quality.

skills.name: Agile principles and values
skills.description: Deep understanding of the Agile Manifesto and its underlying principles

sub-skills.name: The four values of Agile
sub-skills.description: Deep understanding of the four values that underpin the Agile Manifesto

sub-skills.name: The twelve principles of Agile
sub-skills.description: Deep understanding of the twelve principles that underpin the Agile Manifesto

skills.name: Scrum framework
skills.description: Deep understanding of Scrum roles, events, artifacts, and their interactions

sub-skills.name: Scrum roles
sub-skills.description: Deep understanding of the three Scrum roles and their responsibilities

sub-skills.name: Scrum events
sub-skills.description: Deep understanding of the five Scrum events and their purpose

sub-skills.name: Scrum artifacts
sub-skills.description: Deep understanding of the three Scrum artifacts and their purpose

skills.name: User stories
skills.description: Ability to write effective user stories that meet the INVEST criteria

sub-skills.name: Independent
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be completed independently of other stories

sub-skills.name: Negotiable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be refined or changed over time

sub-skills.name: Valuable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that deliver value to the customer

sub-skills.name: Estimable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be estimated

sub-skills.name: Small
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that are small enough to be completed in a single development iteration

sub-skills.name: Testable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be tested and verified

skills.name: Agile planning and estimation
skills.description: Ability to create and estimate work items in an Agile project

sub-skills.name: Task creation
sub-skills.description: Ability to break down user stories into actionable tasks

sub-skills.name: Estimation
sub-skills.description: Ability to estimate the effort required for a given task or user story, using techniques like planning poker or affinity estimation

sub-skills.name: Prioritization
sub-skills.description: Ability to prioritize user stories or tasks based on business value, technical dependencies, or other criteria

skills.name: Agile team collaboration
skills.description: Ability to collaborate effectively within an Agile team and with stakeholders

sub-skills.name: Communication
sub-skills.description: Ability to communicate effectively within the team and with stakeholders, using techniques like daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives

sub-skills.name: Collaboration
sub-skills.description: Ability to work collaboratively within the team and across functional areas, using techniques like pair programming, mob programming, and cross-functional training

sub-skills.name: Self-organization
sub-skills.description: Ability to work in a self-organizing team environment, where team members are empowered to make decisions and take ownership of their work

skills.name: Agile technical practices
skills.description: Ability to apply Agile technical practices to software development, using techniques like continuous integration, test-driven development, and refactoring

sub-skills.name: Continuous integration
sub-skills.description: Ability to set up and maintain a continuous integration pipeline, using tools like Jenkins, Travis CI, or CircleCI

sub-skills.name: Test-driven development
sub-skills.description: Ability to write automated tests before writing code, using techniques like unit testing, integration testing, and acceptance testing

sub-skills.name: Refactoring
sub-skills.description: Ability to refactor code to improve its design, maintainability, and extensibility, using techniques like SOLID principles, design patterns, and code smells
